ImageElement Class Reference

#include <ImageElement.h>

Inheritance diagram for ImageElement:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Image elements are field elements that display an image.

Definition at line 18 of file ImageElement.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Alignment [inherited]
 

The vertical alignment of the element within the list or tree field cell.

Enumeration values:
ALIGN_TOP  Center the element to the top.

ALIGN_CENTER  Center the element to the center.

ALIGN_BOTTOM  Center the element to the bottom.

Member Function Documentation

void appendListener (  Listener *  listener  )  [inherited]
 

Adds a listener at the end of the listeners of this listenable object.

Appended listeners are called last.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

virtual void draw (  DrawingContext &  context  )  [virtual]
 

Draws the content of the field element to the display surface.

This is usually achieved by delegating to the current skin.

Parameters:
context The drawing context that specifies the surface and clipping rectangle for the drawing operation. This context is already translated for the current field element position and available size (e.g. list field column).
See also:
Desktop::getSkin()

Reimplemented from FieldElement.

void drawElements (  DrawingContext &  context,
const ArrayList< FieldElement > &  elements,
int  height,
int  elementSpaceWidth = 0,
bool  textElements = true,
bool  nonTextElements = true
)  [static, inherited]
 

Draws a number of field elements, respecting their vertical alignments.

This is a helper you can use in your field implementations.

Parameters:
context The current drawing context. Drawing starts at the top-left corner of this context.
elements The field elements.
height The available height of the field element container. Used for vertical alignment.
elementSpaceWidth The space between two field elements.
textElements Whether to draw text elements, false skips them, but leaves a space.
nonTextElements Whether to draw non-text elements, false skips them, but leaves a space.

virtual void edit (  Vector  position,
Vector  size,
ScrollingField *  scrollingField = NULL
)  [virtual]
 

Opens a popup to edit the field element.

This method is typically called by the field (e.g. list or tree field) when receiving the onEdit() event.

Parameters:
position The absolute position of the top-left corner of the inner edit field of the popup.
size The size of the inner edit field of the popup.
scrollingField The scrolling field the popup is created for, or NULL, if the popup is not created for any scrolling field. Setting a scrolling field enables the popup to move if the scrolling field is scrolled. Defaults to NULL.

Reimplemented from FieldElement.

Returns the vertical alignment of the element within the list or tree field cell.

Returns the image of the element.

May be NULL, displaying no image.

Returns:

const ArrayList<Listener>& getListeners (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns all currently registered listeners.

Listeners are called in the order they have been appended.

Returns:
The listeners.

void* getModel (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Returns:
The application (or game) defined data.

void* getParent (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the parent of this element.

E.g. for list fields, this is the cell, and for tree fields, this is the item.

Returns:
The parent of this element.

virtual Vector getSize (   )  [virtual]
 

Returns the size of the field element.

Returns:
The size of the field element.

Reimplemented from FieldElement.

SkinData* getSkinData (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Returns:
The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

void setFieldAndParent (  Field *  field,
void *  parent
)  [inherited]
 

Informs the field element about the field that contains it.

Also informs about ts parent. E.g. for list fields, this is the cell, and for tree fields, this is the item. This method should not be called by client, but by the field providing adder methods for field elements.

Note:
This method may be called only once.
Parameters:
field The field that adds the field element.
parent The parent of the field element.

void setImage (  Image *  image  ) 
 

Sets the image of the element.

May be NULL, displaying no image.

Parameters:
image The image to be set or NULL.

void setImageId (  const char *  imageId  ) 
 

Sets the image of the element by its ID.

Parameters:
imageId The ID of the image to be set.

void setImageId (  const String &  imageId  ) 
 

Sets the image of the element by its ID.

Parameters:
imageId The ID of the image to be set.

void setModel (  void *  model,
void(*  modelDestructor)(void *model) = NULL
)  [inherited]
 

Sets the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Parameters:
model The application (or game) defined data.
modelDestructor An optional static method that is called, whenever the glaziery object is destroyed or when a new model is set. Specify this function only, if the model must be destroyed by this glaziery object, i.e. the object "owns" the model. If the model is a glaziery object itself, you may use the GlazieryObject::destructor() function.
See also:
destructor()

virtual void setSkinData (  SkinData *  skinData  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Sets the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Parameters:
skinData The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

Any previously set skin data is automatically destroyed.

Reimplemented in Component.

The string representation.
